noun.description: A verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction.
examples: you asked for comments on the new proposals
the company would not comment on the venture
the review commented that the book was agreeably written

phrases: There is always a risk of getting sucked into the firestorm, so no comment is often a judicious approach.
When asked how aware he and his teammates were of the hostage situation, he said, "No comment."
As for her golf handicap, she declines to reveal what hers is, saying only, "No comment" when the question is asked.
I had no evidence, and would get denials or no comment if I questioned the alleged lovers.
The editor-in-chief says "No comment" to pretty much every interesting question.
origin: Late Middle English (in the senses expository treatise and explanatory note): from Latin commentum contrivance (in late Latin also interpretation), neuter past participle of comminisci devise.
